title: Whispers by the Archon's Grace
setting_narration: The evening sun casts long shadows over the Statue of the Seven, its ancient stone glowing with a soft, ethereal light. A gentle breeze whispers through the trees, carrying the faint scent of cecilias. Below the imposing statue, Amber and Barbara sit on the cool steps, a comfortable silence settling between them as the day slowly gives way to twilight.

segments.text: Barbara traces a pattern on the worn stone with her finger, a thoughtful expression on her face. Amber watches the distant city lights begin to twinkle.

segments.speaker: Barbara
segments.line: It's peaceful here, isn't it? Makes you think about... everything.

segments.speaker: Amber
segments.line: Yeah, it does. What's on your mind, Barbara? You look a little... wistful.

segments.speaker: Barbara
segments.line: Just... past feelings, I suppose. Sometimes I wonder if they ever knew how much I admired them. Those silly crushes from when I was younger.

segments.text: Amber nods slowly, a flicker of understanding in her eyes. The wind picks up slightly, rustling Barbara's habit.

segments.speaker: Amber
segments.line: Oh, I know that feeling! Itâ€™s funny, isn't it? You put so much energy into someone, and then... poof, they're just a memory. Sometimes I wish I'd been a bit braver.

segments.speaker: Barbara
segments.line: Brave enough to tell them? I always thought I should focus on my duties, on my singing... but my heart had a mind of its own sometimes. It's a little embarrassing to think about now.

segments.speaker: Amber
segments.line: No need to be embarrassed! It just means you have a big heart, Barbara. And who knows? Maybe they felt it too, in their own way. My past... 'adventures' were usually with people who were just passing through. Exciting, but always fleeting.

segments.text: A comfortable silence falls between them once more, both girls lost in their own thoughts of bygone affections. The stars begin to emerge in the darkening sky, one by one.

segments.speaker: Barbara
segments.line: But I think it helped me grow, you know? To understand love, even if it wasn't reciprocated. It made me appreciate the love I have for everyone in Mondstadt even more.

segments.speaker: Amber
segments.line: Exactly! Every little crush, every fluttery feeling... it all just makes us stronger and a little wiser. Besides, we've got plenty of love to give, right? To our friends, to our city!

segments.text: Barbara giggles, a melodious sound that echoes softly in the twilight. They share a warm, knowing look, the weight of their past affections momentarily lifted, replaced by the simple comfort of enduring friendship under the watchful gaze of the Anemo Archon.
